column1: Our attention was called to the fact that there was "practicing" going on
column4: see quick flashes. That these flashes pointed directly at Scarborough we did not for a few minutes comprehend. Then
column6: we saw a fog that was partly smoke. The castle grew into its place in the six miles distance. It seemed for a moment that the eight-foot-thick Norman walls tottered; but no
column7: whatever tottered was behind the keep. Curiously enough we could barely hear the cannonading
column8: for the wind was keen in the opposite direction
column10: as the minutes crept by and the air cleared
column11: see distinctly the flashes from the boats and the flashes in the city.After about fifteen minutes there was a cessation
column13: that lasted two minutes; then the flashes continued.
